scenarios.title: Routine Stop
scenarios.what_this_means: The officer is signaling you to pull over for a routine check or traffic management.
scenarios.simple_explanation: The officer is signaling you to pull over for a routine check or traffic management.
when_it_is_valid: Any uniformed officer can signal you to stop.
MV Act Section 132 requires you to stop when signaled.
what_you_can_say: Yes officer?
Is there a problem?
I have pulled over as requested.
scenarios.what_to_say: Yes officer? Is there a problem?
what_not_to_say: I am in a hurry, let me go.
scenarios.what_happens_next: They will usually ask for your documents (License/RC) or check for violations.
scenarios.common_misconception: You can ignore them if you didn't break a rule. (False, you must stop).

scenarios.title: License & RC Check
scenarios.what_this_means: The officer is verifying your eligibility to drive and vehicle ownership.
scenarios.simple_explanation: The officer is verifying your eligibility to drive and vehicle ownership.
when_it_is_valid: Uniformed officer can ask for documents anytime.
You can show digital versions (DigiLocker/mParivahan).
what_you_can_say: Here is my original License/RC.
I have the documents on DigiLocker, showing you now.
scenarios.what_to_say: Here is my original License/RC. I have the documents on DigiLocker.
what_not_to_say: You can't check me without a reason.
I forgot them at home (Instant challan).
scenarios.what_happens_next: They verify validity. If valid, you go. If not, a challan is issued.
scenarios.common_misconception: Police can snatch your license. (They can only seize it for specific offenses like drunk driving).

scenarios.title: Helmet / Seatbelt Fine
police_says: Piche wale ka helmet kahan hai?
scenarios.what_this_means: You have been stopped for a visible safety violation.
scenarios.simple_explanation: You have been stopped for a visible safety violation.
when_it_is_valid: If you or pillion rider are not wearing a helmet.
If driver or co-passengers are not wearing seatbelts.
what_you_can_say: I apologize, I made a mistake.
Please issue the challan.
For medical reasons I removed it (if true).
scenarios.what_to_say: I apologize, I made a mistake. Please issue the challan.
what_not_to_say: It's too hot for a helmet.
scenarios.common_misconception: Pillion riders don't need helmets. (Most states mandate it).

scenarios.title: Wrong-side / Signal Jump
scenarios.what_this_means: You are accused of driving in a prohibited direction or disobeying traffic signals.
scenarios.simple_explanation: You are accused of driving in a prohibited direction or disobeying traffic signals.
when_it_is_valid: If you crossed stop line at red light.
If you drove against traffic flow.
what_you_can_say: I apologize.
Please show me the camera proof if available (calmly).
Please issue the challan.
scenarios.what_to_say: I apologize. Please issue the challan.
scenarios.what_happens_next: Challan issuance. For dangerous driving, license seizure is possible.
scenarios.common_misconception: You can turn left on red always. (Only if 'Free Left' sign exists).

scenarios.title: Drunk Driving Suspicion
scenarios.what_this_means: Officer suspects you are driving under the influence of alcohol/drugs.
scenarios.simple_explanation: Officer suspects you are driving under the influence of alcohol/drugs. They can demand a breath test.
when_it_is_valid: Officer can demand a breath test using a breathalyzer.
Refusal can lead to arrest/hospital test.
what_you_can_say: I have not consumed alcohol.
I am ready to take the breathalyzer test.
Please use a fresh nozzle.
scenarios.what_to_say: I have not consumed alcohol. I am ready to take the breathalyzer test.
what_not_to_say: No, I won't create a scene.
scenarios.what_happens_next: If reading > 30mg/100ml, you are booked. Vehicle seized. Challan sent to court.
scenarios.common_misconception: Police can fine you on the spot/cash for drunk driving. (Never. It is always a Court Challan).

scenarios.title: Phone Checking Demand
scenarios.what_this_means: Officer is attempting to access your private data or stop you from recording.
scenarios.simple_explanation: Officer is attempting to access your private data. This is generally illegal without a warrant.
when_it_is_valid: Generally illegal without a warrant.
Exception: Checking digital documents if you claim to have them.
what_you_can_say: Officer, my phone is my private property.
I can show you my documents, but I cannot unlock my gallery.
There is no law that requires me to show my chats.
scenarios.what_to_say: Officer, my phone is private. I can show documents, but cannot unlock my gallery.
scenarios.what_happens_next: Politely refuse. You have a right to record police in public duties.
scenarios.common_misconception: Police can check your phone for 'security'. (False).

scenarios.title: “Come to station” Threat
scenarios.summary: Threat to take to Police Station
scenarios.what_this_means: Intimidation tactic to get compliance or a bribe, OR serious detention.
scenarios.simple_explanation: Intimidation tactic. Police cannot arrest you for minor traffic violations.
when_it_is_valid: Valid only if arrested for a cognizable offense (Drunk driving, rash driving affecting safety).
Invalid for minor traffic violations.
what_you_can_say: Am I under arrest? For what offense?
For a traffic challan, I am ready to accept the fine here or digitally.
I will call my lawyer/family if you are detaining me.
scenarios.what_to_say: Am I under arrest? For a traffic challan, I am ready to accept the fine here.
scenarios.what_happens_next: If minor offense, they usually back down if you stand firm on 'Issue Challan'.
scenarios.common_misconception: Police can take you to station for not having license. (They can fine you, maybe seize vehicle, but arrest is extreme).

scenarios.title: Spot Fine vs Challan
police_says: Machine kharab hai, cash de do
scenarios.what_this_means: Officer is offering an on-spot settlement. Could be legal compounding OR a bribe.
scenarios.simple_explanation: Officer is offering an on-spot settlement. Beware of bribes masquerading as fines.
when_it_is_valid: Only ASI (1 star) or above can collect spot fines.
MUST provide a receipt (e-challan printout or receipt book).
Constables cannot take money.
what_you_can_say: I want an official receipt/challan.
I will pay online via e-Challan.
I don't have cash, please issue challan.
scenarios.what_to_say: I want an official receipt. I will pay online via e-Challan.
scenarios.what_happens_next: If valid, they give receipt. If bribe attempt, they might issue actual challan.
scenarios.common_misconception: You must pay cash on the spot. (You almost always have option to pay later online or in court).

scenarios.title: Vehicle Seizure Threat
scenarios.what_this_means: Threat to impound vehicle. Often used to pressure; or valid for serious lack of documents.
scenarios.simple_explanation: Threat to impound vehicle. Valid only for serious offenses like no RC or Drunk Driving.
when_it_is_valid: No valid Registration (RC).
No Permit (commercial).
Drunk driving.
Vehicle involved in crime.
what_you_can_say: On what grounds are you seizing my vehicle?
I have my RC and license, you cannot seize for minor violations.
Please give me a 'Seizure Memo' if you take it.
Do not snatch my keys, I am cooperating.
scenarios.what_to_say: On what grounds are you seizing? I have documents. Please give a Seizure Memo.
scenarios.what_happens_next: If seizing, they MUST give a seizure list (Panchnama).
scenarios.common_misconception: Police can seize bike for no insurance. (Usually just a fine).

scenarios.title: Bribe Hint (“Adjust kar lo”)
police_says: Kuch le de ke khatam karo
scenarios.what_this_means: The officer is indirectly soliciting a bribe.
scenarios.simple_explanation: The officer is asking for a bribe to avoid issuing a formal fine.
when_it_is_valid: Never legal.
what_you_can_say: I would prefer the official challan.
I don't have cash.
Please just issue the fine, I will handle it.
scenarios.what_to_say: I would prefer the official challan. Please issue the fine.
what_not_to_say: Identifying yourself as a bribe giver.
scenarios.what_happens_next: If you refuse to bribe, they will issue the actual challan.
scenarios.common_misconception: Paying bribe is cheaper. (It encourages corruption and offers no legal clearance).
